meanings.definition: Foul or disgusting in appearance or smell.
meanings.sent1: The mankiest garbage can was left out in the sun for days.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud all day, his clothes were the mankiest in the group.
meanings.sent3: The mankiest socks in the laundry basket made everyone wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: The mankiest alley in town was avoided by all the residents.
meanings.sent5: The mankiest smell from the kitchen hinted at burnt dinner.

meanings.sent1: She wore the mankiest shoes to the muddy field.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic's hands were the mankiest after fixing the car engine.
meanings.sent3: The mankiest mop in the janitor's closet had seen better days.
meanings.sent4: The mankiest pond in the forest was home to many frogs.
meanings.sent5: The mankiest windows in the old house were covered in grime.

meanings.sent1: He was known as the mankiest person in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The mankiest of all the options was chosen by mistake.
meanings.sent3: The mankiest painting in the gallery was oddly popular.
meanings.sent4: The mankiest corner of the room gathered dust unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The mankiest costume at the party stood out for all the wrong reasons.
